instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00281: What is 820-00281? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3: What is PPBUS_G3? This is a typo of PPBUS_G3H. When you see PPBUS_G3, assume they meant to type PPBUS_G3H.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image/backlight. But...
threads.message:
Very small liquid damage near jack connector on board.

When is turned on with charger I see Apple logo to 1 second and then there is no backlight. I see image. Can log in but no backlight. 
As soon charger is disconnected there is no image on display. When charger connected again no backlight but image works.

Tested on external display and when charger is connected all works great on ext. display. Charger not connected and there is no image/backlight on ext display.

Any idea where start?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image/backlight. But...
threads.message: There is short to ground on backlight fuse (fuse not blown) so removed it and short in on F8400/1 which is  <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3</SIGNAL>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image/backlight. But...
threads.message:
Let me guess; you are measuring continuity on a powered board :(
Cannot have short on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> if machine works; even if backlight is missing.

Post <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> value.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image/backlight. But...
threads.message:
Got 3.40V on J4501/1

<DIODE>D8410</DIODE>/K at 0.2V
F8400/2 at 12.95V
<RESISTOR>R8442</RESISTOR>/2 at 0.00V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image/backlight. But...
threads.message:
"I see Apple logo to 1 second and then there is no backlight"
Do you get backlight for 1s?

PRAM reset done?
<SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> measured with LCD connected and both situations, charger yes and no, same 3.4V?

What happens if start in SMC bypass?
